reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

 *RDA*/ Velocity *Coil*/ 6 Wrap Single Fused Kanthal Clapton 2×26 core 32 wrap *W*/ 45 
*Wicking*/ Full Cotton *Ω*/0.26 
          
**Testing**        

*Steep Time*/2 weeks *% Used*/ 1   
*PG/VG* 50/50 *Nic%*/0          
            
**Mouth Feel** 

Light on the palate and heavy on the nose, moderately dense 5 out of 10.

**Throat Hit** 1/10           

**Flavor Properties**

 Slightly piney with a rich floral accent, together they are savory and definitely have umami.

**Relatable Flavors** 

Rosemary as mentioned earlier it is a little piney, I would have to say reminds me of chewing on pine needles but I don't think that does it justice.                       
                            
**Off Flavors** 

Not noticing any aftertaste or any odd flavor notes, that don't belong there it's kind of an odd flavor but it's delicious.

**Position In The Recipe** 

This flavoring should work well in any Savory base, and work well as an accent with most fruits by providing contrast, it should really push flavors to a new level.

**Pairings** 

Savory and other Florals flavors should pair nicely, creams, vanilla's and other  spice flavorings, and most fruits especially dark berry flavorings should work very well.             

**Notes**                

http://www.ecigexpress.com/diy-e-liquid/diy-e-liquid-flavors/inawera/fruit-and-sweet/shisha-rosemary-by-inawera-10ml.html        

**Rating** 98/100    

*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list with multiple reviews in one spot.*
reviewsJson.author: Chrisdvr1
reviewsJson.title: Shisha Rosemary
